intro: Gongylolepis benthamiana, commonly known as the bentham's gongylolepis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has lanceolate leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Gongylolepis benthamiana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
